intro: Aeschynomene bracteosa var. delicatula, commonly known as the silky aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its finely hairy, slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense, racemose inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid conditions, making it a hardy and adaptable species. Its botanical features make it of interest for both ecological studies and potential agricultural use.
